intro: Knautia montana, commonly known as mountain knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered blooms of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and aromatic. Knautia montana is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
